review:
В начале игра напоминает полноценный Arx. Но после той крепости дальнейший путь и задача меняется. Нужно добраться до ледяного дракона и с ним поговорить, а после этого игра заканчивается. Стоит отметить огромное количество багов с текстурами и диалогами. В некоторых моментах их вообще нет. Скорее всего демоверсию никто не трогал со времён её добавления в Steam. 

Но всё же это тот же самый Arx.

[b][i]-Педя Мох[/i][/b]

I tried it for the interesting magic system, where you draw runes in sequence for spells, but while that is cool and all the game itself does not stand up well. If you did not grow up with games like this, as in you were in your early-to-mid teens when these were legitimate graphics and game style, I would not recomend getting this. Otherwise this game will just feel very empty.

Итак, вы - голый мужик, который очнулся в тюрьме и пытается сообразить - "Каким непостижимым образом я тут оказался и где мои штаны, черт бы вас побрал?!" Что ж, отправляемся на поиски штанов, ибо дубак в камере не шуточный, как бы не отморозить все свое самое ценное, лелеямое и с любовью пестуемое. 
В углу сожрав пару грибочков, вы услышите голос. Нет, это не глюки. Это сосед по камере, который видел, как вы тут оказались. Выбираемся из камеры, костью аки доисторический человек убиваем гоблина-охранника и выпускаем соседа. 
"Я слишком слаб, беги, не жди меня, спасайся!" - кричит он в лучшем стиле Гендальфа и... сталкивает нас в крысиную яму. И, кстати, крысы тут размером с хорошо откормленного теленка! После убийства крысы потрошим ее тушку, достаем еще недоваренные чьи-то ребрышки и едим. Брезгуем, не брезгуем - но игра готовит нас к суровой жизни в мире Арх.
За углом находим чей-то скелет, мародерствуем - и стаскиваем с него штаны. Ему-то уже все равно, а у вас вся мужская гордость от холода розочкой свернулась.
А дальше начинается ваше путешествие. Подбирайте все, что можно подобрать - это одна из тех игр, в которой совершенно неизвестно, когда и что понадобится. Немного бисячая система боя, но так что же вы хотите от игры 2002 года? Да, графофилы могут проходить мимо, любители пострелять - тоже. 
Но те самые люди, которые любят этот великолепный жанр РПГ от 1 лица с элементами стелса и квеста - добро пожаловать! Ведь это старый добрый олдскул. Игра 2002 года пусть не испугает вас графикой, а покорит той самой атмосферностью и сюжетом, которые нынче и днем с огнем не сыскать! Игра напоминает the Elder Scrolls III - Morrowind тем своим непередаваемым геймплеем. Здесь вам не будет обучения, подсветки вещей, подсказок как для тупых. Думайте сами и над всем. Тут вас не сразу кинут в бой в одних трусах, не дав толком разобраться с управлением.

I like the fact you can pilot new ships and it's expanded in other ways, but unfortunately the crazy price increase compared to Beyond The Frontier, makes this game an impossible grind.  

Personally I'd skip this one and go straight to X-2 after completing Beyond The Frontier.

I last played the X series back in 2010, and that was already an old game but a classic for me.
I own the box version with hardcopy manual, but bought them on steam again just to ensure I would not loose this gem.

The X-Beyond the Frontier is a bit too rough for me to play through the whole story again. I believe there are some YouTube video of the whole storyline as a quick playthrough if you want to see it again.
The X-Tension on Steam, thanks to the latest updates from egosoft, has an easier user interface and is more of an open world introducing you to the "X" universe that we then play with X2, X3, X4 .. but at least in X-Tension you can get in your ship's pilot seat.

You can access special options with "Shift O"; use that to disable the missions until you are ready for it, and also incease the SETA speed multiplier.

If you have a slow start grinding to get a better ship, I don't know if the old bug of ejecting in front of the shipyard and trying ti select a mammoth as your ship still works ; I did two different save files, send them to ChatGPT 3o and told him how many credits I had in each file, to help isolate where the value is stored, and asked to change my credits to 150 millions: I see no point spending days grinding and took the fastline to start building.

The game is usually somewhere around 5€ and is now less than 1€ ; don't pass on it .. even at 5€ I would buy if I did not have it already.

The game has Steam cloud save, can change screen resolutions, can adjust keyboard layount, etc etc etc ...

the ONLY negative I could find, which really can't be blamed for a game which is over 20 years ols, is that there is no Steam Success or trading cards for it. that's OK for me since I cheated with the cash anyway.
choujiangchoudaodeyouxi
Yes its an oldie but a classic. Wish EGOSOFT would remake all of there old games as DLC's into there new X4 engine. The ships is already there. Just port over the story and voice files.

Сегодня игре стукнуло 25 лет.

Одна из любимых игр (и серий), первый космосим, который затянул реально надолго, на многие месяцы.

Спасибо EGOSOFTу за то, что четверть века с душой поддерживают самобытную серию, которая с каждой номерной частью становится всё лучше.

Куча добрых воспоминаний, особенно об уютных вечерах на форуме Elite Games под треск диалапа...

Обсуждения боёвки, экономики, захвата кораблей (особенно Персея), геноцид Ксенонов, покупка первой фабрики, производственные цепочки...
Ожидание X2 The Threat, разговоры о всяких Вавилонах и Стартреках, пиsькомеряние скриншотами, у кого всего больше, троллинг новичков, впервые увидевших НЛО...

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3491348475

Если вдруг кто из тех времён забрёл сюда, привет вам, коллеги по увлечению о7
люблю космос...

A good game if you like the X series with all its good and bad parts. Its more of an open world unscripted experiance with the ability to fly different ships compared to the original. The economy is also very much rebalanced and more expansive than the original XBtF. Consider it a slightly improved and complex version of XBtF as far as the open world and economy is concerned and a more basic early version of X2: The Threat, while the combat si more or less the same in all of them. I do prefer the original for its simplicity when buying new ships to help you out and less costly stuff all around but thats me.

Ох когда это было... Хорошая графика... Музыка вообще выше всяких похвал.
Как раз тогда Начали практиковать записи из игры музыки покругу часами. 
Сайт ЭлитГеймс, (elite-games.ru)выкладывание музыки по мотивам, это 2000год...
Сейчас можно запустить и на новом железе. Но у меня проблемы настроек и совместимости разрешений. 1920*1080*32 края уходят за край экрана сильно 8))

кому нужен мануал по игре объяснения и подробности по игре.
добро пожаловать в elite-games.ru/x-tension/
Всё ещё живы.

X: Tension é uma expansão de X: Beyond the Frontier sem campanha e totakmente focada no sandbox, de certa forma muito parecida com os jogos mais atuais. O jogo funciona bem pelo tempo que testei, mas os jogos mais novos são BEM melhores, tanto em gráficos, quanto em gameplay.
A razão do meu "não" é que se for pra jogar sandbox compro o X mais novo que você conseguir, até  o X2 é bem melhor que esse jogo,  Beyond the Frontier  pelo menso têm uma história diferente (que também não é uma maravilha, mas funciona), só compre se for pra colecionar.
---------------------
X: Tension is an expansion for X: Beyond the Frontier with no campaign and completely focused on the sandbox, in a way very similar to the most recent games. The game works well for the time I tested it, but the newer games are MUCH better, both in graphics and gameplay.
The reason I said "no" is that if I'm going to play a sandbox game, I'll buy the newest X you can get, even X2 is much better than this game. At least Beyond the Frontier has a different story (which isn't great either, but it works). Only buy it if you're going to collect it.

Histoire :
X-Tension est une extension de X: Beyond the Frontier, mais elle abandonne en grande partie le fil conducteur scénaristique du jeu de base. Le joueur incarne un pilote, toujours dans l’univers des X, mais cette fois avec une plus grande liberté d’exploration. Il n’y a pas de véritable histoire centrale à suivre, ce qui permet une expérience sandbox pure où vous êtes libre de construire votre empire commercial, devenir un redoutable pirate ou un explorateur. Pour ceux qui apprécient les récits dirigés, l'absence d'une intrigue forte peut être décevante, mais l’aspect immersif de la liberté offerte compense largement.

Gameplay :
Le gameplay de X-Tension repose sur une expérience spatiale ouverte où vous pouvez vous adonner à diverses activités telles que le commerce, le combat, et l'exploration. Vous pouvez désormais piloter plusieurs types de vaisseaux, ce qui offre une grande variété dans l'approche des missions ou des affrontements. Le jeu reprend la mécanique de base de X: Beyond the Frontier avec une amélioration notable des systèmes économiques et des mécaniques de gestion de flotte. L'univers est vaste, avec des dizaines de secteurs à explorer, chacun rempli de stations, de vaisseaux et d’opportunités commerciales. Cependant, la courbe d'apprentissage est assez raide, et les joueurs qui recherchent une prise en main rapide pourraient être découragés par la complexité du système économique et la gestion des vaisseaux. La liberté est énorme, mais le manque de direction peut rendre certaines sessions de jeu un peu vagues ou répétitives.

Graphismes :
Pour un jeu sorti en 2000, les graphismes de X-Tension étaient impressionnants à l’époque, avec des environnements spatiaux vastes et des modèles de vaisseaux détaillés. Toutefois, avec les années, les visuels ont pris un coup de vieux, surtout en comparaison avec les standards actuels. Les stations spatiales, bien que fonctionnelles, sont assez basiques dans leur design, et les arrière-plans stellaires manquent parfois de détails. Cela dit, l'immersion est toujours présente grâce à la diversité des systèmes stellaires et aux effets de lumière qui, bien que datés, parviennent à créer une atmosphère unique. Des mods et des paramètres d'affichage peuvent aider à améliorer l'expérience visuelle, mais il est évident que le jeu montre son âge.

Difficulté :
X-Tension est un jeu difficile à maîtriser, surtout pour les nouveaux venus dans les simulations spatiales. Les commandes sont complexes, la gestion des ressources demande une attention constante, et le jeu ne tient pas la main du joueur. Le côté sandbox ajoute une dimension d'exploration libre, mais cela peut parfois laisser le joueur un peu perdu sans direction claire. Les combats spatiaux nécessitent de bonnes compétences de pilotage et de gestion des systèmes d'armes, et le commerce demande de comprendre les subtilités du marché galactique pour en tirer profit. La courbe d'apprentissage est donc raide, mais pour les amateurs de simulation spatiale hardcore, la satisfaction vient avec le temps et la persévérance.

Durée de vie :
En termes de contenu, X-Tension propose des centaines d’heures de jeu potentiel. C’est un véritable bac à sable où vous pouvez choisir de vous concentrer sur le commerce, la conquête ou simplement l'exploration de l'univers. Il n'y a pas de fin claire, ce qui signifie que vous pouvez passer autant de temps que vous le souhaitez à développer votre flotte ou à découvrir de nouveaux secteurs. Pour les joueurs qui apprécient les expériences ouvertes avec beaucoup de liberté, X-Tension est une mine d’or. Cependant, sans véritable objectif final ou progression narrative, certains joueurs peuvent trouver que la motivation diminue après avoir exploré la plupart des mécaniques du jeu.

Prix (en solde) :
X-Tension est régulièrement proposé à un prix très bas lors des soldes Steam, souvent à moins de 5 euros. À ce prix, c'est un excellent choix pour les amateurs de simulations spatiales ou ceux qui souhaitent découvrir les racines de la série X. Même à plein tarif, le jeu reste abordable et offre un excellent rapport contenu/prix pour sa taille et sa profondeur, surtout si vous appréciez les jeux de gestion et de commerce dans un cadre spatial.

Conclusion :
X-Tension est une extension qui donne aux joueurs une liberté presque totale dans un vaste univers spatial. Bien que l'absence d'une histoire centrale puisse désorienter certains, la profondeur de l'expérience de simulation, le commerce et les combats spatiaux compensent largement. Si vous recherchez une simulation spatiale open world complexe, avec une bonne dose de gestion et d'exploration, ce jeu offre une expérience riche et captivante. C'est une recommandation forte, surtout à prix réduit, pour les fans de jeux de gestion et d’exploration spatiale à la recherche d'une immersion totale dans l'univers des X.

Horrible controls and same problems as X-BTF.
Can be interesting only for nostalgia.

Excellent follow-up to the first game. However, this is more of a game for fans of Egosoft's X-series. For newbies, I recommend looking at X2, or one of the X3 titles. With that being said, this is WAY more accessible than the first game, with an enormous number of useful features being added.

This game is very light on plot, so some players may pass it over if they prefer a more story-driven game. There is exactly one plotline, which is unlocked fairly late (you need good relations with the Paranid) and which is quite difficult, so you will want to take your time and expand your resources before starting it.

There are some annoyances. Viewing sectors that you are not in REQUIRES a navsat in that sector. This also goes for using the jumpdrive and ordering ships. If you are not in the sector and do not have a navsat there, then you CANNOT jump to that sector or give orders to your ships and stations there. People coming from X2 or newer games will probably find this very irritating. There are also some other details, like a lack of sell orders for trade ships, for example. In general, the complexity is higher than the first game but still much lower than X2.

This game is complete enough that you might play for some time after finishing the plot, but due to the aforementioned annoyances and lower quality compared to later games you probably would not make this your mainstay as an X-series fan. The first game in the series to really nail the 'I could just keep playing this for hundreds of hours' feeling is X2: The Threat. In my opinion.

Compatibility-wise it suffers from similar issues to the first game. Compatibility with versions of Windows newer than 7 is flaky at best. Linux users may have an easier time as the game works on Proton Experimental as of September 2024. However, while the game is more stable than the first on Proton, intermittent crashes are still a problem. And NPC portraits are still broken. GE-Proton9-11 made the game more stable and fixed the portrait issues. Lutris' Wine-GE also works and was more stable than GE-Proton in my experience.

Pretty good considering its age. Definitely one of my least played X games though. I jumped from the original straight to X2 so I had barely touched this until recently when I finally got around to finishing it.

This is when X truly became X.  Buy it, put about 150 hours into XBTF, then XT, then X2, read all the books, then open up x3, finish all the dlc, everyting, then move onto rebirth for something a little different, not terrible, just not like the previous games.  Then X4.  X4 is it boys and girls... that is legit awesome.

Empfehlenswert: Ja (persönliche Wertung: 6/10)

Errungenschaften: Nein

Positiv:
- Mehr Sektoren
- Andere Schiffe
- Neue Missionen

Negativ:
- Steuerung schlecht
- Kaum Story

Fazit:
Bei X-Tension handelt es sich grob gesagt um die Erweiterung von X: Beyond the Frontier. Storymäßig kommt nicht viel hinzu, wenn man diesen Teil überspringt, hat man nicht viel verpasst.
Was neu hinzugekommen ist, sind neue Sektoren (darunter Piratensektoren), das man andere Schiffe steuern kann und das kapern von Schiffen. Ein paar neue Missionen sind auch noch hinzugekommen.
An sich nur eine Verbesserung des Gameplay. Es macht dennoch richtig Laune. Empfehlenswert!!!!

Schöne Fortsetzung von Teil 1. Die Neuerung in Sachen Handel und Grafik sind deutlich sichtbar. Als Vorbereitung auf X2 auf jeden Fall zu gebrauchen. Freue mich schon mein Handelsimperium aufzubauen. Einzig die Controller Steuerung könnte besser sein.
A golden classic with a lot of freedom.
My first X game was X2: The Threat.  It was fun seeing what came before.

Wer X-Beyond the Froniter kennt, und nicht genug davon kriegen kann, hat mit X-Tension mehr als genug zu tun. Wer hier das quasi Ende des Spieles erreichen möchte braucht verdammt viel Durchhaltevermögen und eine gute Vorbereitung.

Works on win 10 just fine. However, using the mouse to steer the ship is awful. Thankfully, you can use a controller to control the ship and use keyboard controls for everything else.

The gameplay is very similar to X:BTF but slightly improved and expanded upon. There's missions you can accept, you can fly any ship (Except destroyers and carriers) and there's more sectors to explore.

If you're interested in this genre, this game is really good though it has its quirks. There is a point or two where you end up feeling a bit aimless. I recommend using the fan made engine for it called Arx Libertatis.
Exelente Dungeon Crawler con puzzles

Arx Fatalis: Tma, plísně, kruté hádanky a občas kanibal s horší náladou než daňový poradce v dubnu. Když se vám nedaří, tak klid – v tomhle podzemí je naštvaný úplně každý. Pokud hledáte RPG, kde i chleba může být vražedný nástroj, Arx je přesně pro vás.

Get the Arx Libertatis addon for this game, it makes the experience much more enjoyable. Very solid game quintessential of the style of RPG for its time. Don't fear looking through walkthroughs older than most people playing this game.

Игра отличная в плане проработки мира и в целом механик, очень сильно радует и одновременно удивляет проработка взаимодействия игрока с миром игры, затягивает с первых минут и не отпускает, но если вы не принесли подарок троллю Грю то знайте я вас не уважаю

Purchased here and then played using Arx Libertatis. Out of the box here on steam the gameplay experience isn't good and the Libertatis experience was excellent. 

The game itself is really unique. Combining items is really cool but it takes a very long time before you figure it out and it shows everything its capable of. Spellcasting is really interesting, you get a sense for what some of the symbols mean which is really awesome, it clearly had a massive amount of thought put into it.

Combat is fine-ish. Its either too easy or too challenging. The real pleasure of Arx Fatalis is delving deeper and deeper into the earth, through twisting corridors and unearthing a world that seems to be collapsing in on itself. There are elements of the game that seem mostly to exist to be an inconvenience to you, but the [b]feeling[/b] of Arx is something remarkable. Dated in many ways, but its genuinely a lot of fun.

The game is cumulatively a truly exceptional dungeon delve. Even as a dungeon within a dungeon, the crypt is a masterful experience in and of itself.
Mega spacium

очень рекомендую эту игру, одну из лучших игр в жанре иммерсив-сим. Если вы любите этот жанр, обязательно попробуйте, это реально крутой опыт. Система заклинаний через руны и их комбинации невероятная, ничего подобного, увы, сейчас уже не делают. Также советую поставить Arx Libertatis, исправляет различные ошибки и улучшает опыт от игры

Game shows you almost 0 off what you are supposed to do and how things works, but there is all stuff you need to know online, if you don't want to spend hours trying to figure it on your own.
Overall if you are fan of puzzle/riddle + dark souls games you will not regret playing this game too.

Got stuck in a wall with no way out

Easily one of, if not THE best game I've ever played. For 5 dollars this cannot be beat. You can feel in every part of this game just how much love was put into it. The world, the factions, the people, the NPCs, the story. Everything. Games are rarely made like this nowadays. I won't lie, the game gets HARD the more you go through but if you persevere you will not regret it.

I recommend downloading the mod "Arx Libertatis" I believe it only fixes issues with the game. Doesn't add anything new content and its darn easy to get running. Good luck! And may the Gnoden Guide you, Am Shaegar!

I saw in the news that Venice was flooded and I thought ... don't I have a video game with that same premise? 72 levels later and I feel I have done my part to combat sea-level rise. You're welcome.

I like that this game will allow you to reach the end of the "journey" by playing it safe. You can take your time, take only the safest of shots, and forego bonuses if you just want to make it through without replaying. Alternatively, you can also be a hotshot speed player and rack up a great score through your innate understanding of the physics of throwing vases. Skilled players will probably enjoy pursuing a combo-heavy high score and will get more play hours out of the game by replaying. Less skilled players will probably just be happy to reach the end.

Before purchasing, I recommend you consider which type of player you are so that you will know whether or not this is going to be worth the five bucks. I am pretty sure I got this game in a bundle at some point, so I also recommend waiting for a sale.

รีวิว Venice 

รูปแบบเกมก็ง่ายๆเลย ก็แค่ยิงสิ่งของ (แจกัน แหวน กุญแจ) ให้ตรงกับภาพ จนครบช่องเพื่อจบในแต่ละด่าน ซึ่งตรงนี้เราสามารถทำคอมโบต่อเนื่องได้ เพื่อเพิ่มคะแนนพิเศษ (เทคนิคคือเราจะต้องยิงสิ่งของชิ้นนั้นที่ตำแหน่งบนสุด เพื่อให้กระเด็นลงมาช่องเล็กๆที่อยู่ล่างลงมาเรื่อยๆ ซึ่งสามารถทำคอมโบต่อเนื่องไปด้วย ซึ่งในด่านหลังๆ จะเริ่มมีลูกเล่นบล็อกเคลื่อนย้าย บล็อคเด้ง เพื่อให้ยิงไม่โดนบ้างก็มีเช่นกัน (แนะนำให้ดูวิดีโอตัวอย่างเกมประกอบไปด้วย)

เริ่มต้นเกมจะให้เรา 3 ชีวิต ถ้าสิ่งของกระเด้งลงมา แล้วรับไม่ทัน ก็จะเสีย 1 ชีวิต โดยรวมก็เป็นเกมไว้เล่นฆ่าเวลาที่ดีเกมหนึ่งเลย เพราะระบบการเล่นเข้าใจง่าย casual สุดๆ แต่เล่นไปนานๆ ดูท่าจะกลายเป็นหัวร้อนไปซะมากกว่านะเนี่ย เริ่มยากขึ้นไปทุกทีๆเลยเวรเอ้ย

7/10

Another Popcap Classic.  Many a night I stayed up playing this game when I first had it, and already I am staying up again playing through it a second time.  Like the original wave of Popcaps (Alchemy, Bejewelled, Chuzzle, etc.) ... this is a simple game to learn, but takes a bit of skill to progress.  Lots of fun, challenge is right, and the price is always right.  Wish Popcap would go back to making games like this.

Tags: Casual - Match3
Additional Tags: Delete Local Content & Remove from Library

TLDR: Outcompeted and Derivate. Luxor spin off in which you send objects in appropriate slots from bottom of screen to complete discs. Maxes at low resolutions. 

Review: This is a lot like a bubble game, instead of having different colored bubbles you get one of four random objects with distinctive shapes. Instead of matching 3 you gotta fly in the object in the matching slot on rotating discs higher up on the screen. The discs bounce around and if you hit a higher disc it will fill lower discs on its own and there are silly powerups falling down. You cannot aim and just strage left and right and click. Hitboxes are pretty generous and if you fail you can catch what you threw away back to prevent losing a life. All in all its a pretty mundane experience, trapped in low resolution, no Xbox360 pad support and a rather uninspired setting.
stare jak metuzalem ale dobre, cena je ale prilis vysoka
I have played this game for quite a while and all of a sudden it decides to slowly jerk to where i cannot play it any more . I enjoy the mindless game but am now not so impressed with it.

Venice is a puzzle game from casual game company PopCap.  While the company is very familiar to many people, this game is not.  It's a hidden gem on the PC platform, and it has a harsh difficulty curve.

The game centers around Venice, Italy sinking into the waves, and it's up to you, as a random small-ish gondola, to save the treasures of Venice before all is lost.  It's a better story than Bejeweled, but not exactly AAA writing.  But, for what it needs to do, it sets the game up perfectly.

If you've ever played Luxor or Zuma, the game controls essentially like that.  Your objective is to match all of the shapes without letting any fall into the water below.  This is where the game can and will screw you over multiple times, by placing nearly impossible trick shots that rely on pin-point timing and accuracy.  It can get frustrating, but you feel a good sense of accomplishment after completing the level.

The music is up to PopCap standards, as it fits the gameplay very well, and adds to the atmosphere.  The visuals do the job, but show their age.  Not too much to the point of looking bad, but enough to notice.  I have a reoccuring problem with many of PopCap's games.  It doesn't detect that my graphics card supports hardware acceleration, even though it does.  I'm sporting an AMD Radeon HD 8240, and my old iBook G4 from 2005 supports hardware acceleration.  I don't get it, but the game looks nice even without accelerated graphics.

Overall, I give this game my Seal of Reccomendation.  Pick it up if you want an obscure classic.  I'm not responsible for any hardware-related damage you may inflict upon your system.

Venice Deluxe is a nice little game of shooting treasures at moving tiles. That is about as close to the description of the gameplay mechanic as I can get. I have no idea how to describe it any other way.

With a bit more than 70 levels, Venice Deluxe does offer a few puzzling constellations challenging to think around the corner, in a manner of speaking.

There isn't much more to say. But it definitely is a fun game to play if you are patient enough to get every level down perfectly.
OUI

Not the worst game in Popcap complete pack, but not recommended either.
You shoot symbols from the bottom, hoping to hit a hole that matches. If you fail to catch a symbol that didn't meet any hole and gets bounced back, you fail.
There are various powerups, but that's about all the diversity. Gets boring soon.

Easy point&shoot game with Venice as loose background. Hit targets above base shooter; difficulty varies but tactics easily learned. No pressure, can stop & restart at will.  Good for relaxing & focusing on shooter & target with minimal stress.

Venice is fun action puzzle game from PopCap games.  While the graphics are a little subpar and bland, the gameplay is brisk and the ambient music appropriate.  Surprisingly, the Steam Overlay is supported which is unusual for PopCap titles.  Overall, there is enough gaming goodness here to give Venice a positive recommendation.  For any action puzzlers out there, Venice is a good buy.

All Pop Cap's games are just perfect. Easy to learn, "plug & play" but, with increasing difficulty and clear instructions before every new thing to learn. Intense rythm, you are always clicking the mouse, no time to rest. Original, they can be based on anything else but they do their own way and with outstanding imagination. The right difficulty at the right time, to maintain the interest. Variated play modes. Ridiculous simple controls, usually just the mouse and their two buttons, some times the arrows pad is also neeced but, that's all. Very good music and sound effects....
Well, if you already played Zuma, you know what I mean but, they have other interesting titles and this is one of them.
Highly recommeded for casual tmes, when you are in a hurry and want to play just a bit or, for that "in between big games" time.
ORIGINAL, AS PEEGLES. HIGHLY ADDICTIVE.
